ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a great class to take after already having spent some time with Heidegger. I do not think it is the best introduction to his work because there is such a strong emphasis on a few later essays.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course not only created a foundation for my understanding of the later Heidegger, but also allowed me to situate Being in Time within a larger philosophical project that is ongoing throughout Heidegger's life.
